pronunciation: CONTEMN [Latin , to despise; to drive away.]

definition.text:
1. To despise; to consider and treat as mean and despicable; to scorn.In whose eyes a vile person is contemned. Psalms 1 5:4.
2. To slight; to neglect as unworthy of regard; to reject with disdain.Wherefore do the wicked contemn God. Psalms 10:1 3.They contemn the counsel of the Most High. Psalms 10 7:11.
